sections.Resolution: Conan's clue for discovering Kanemitsu's guilt were the mystery books she had brought to her café and removed after the murders; all of them featured short stories she had already successfully published, and Agatha Christie's The ABC Murders, on which the case was incidentally patterned based on the victims' last names and Kanemitsu's pen name. Kanemitsu, admitting her guilt, subtly left those clues so that only a true mystery fan, who would be Conan, would be able to expose her as the culprit.
